items.q: A resounding response is a _____ one. a. dignified b. quiet c. happy d. loud
If a student comes up with an answer, she _____. a. has to think a while to find the answer b. is absolutely sure of the answer c. got the answer from someone else d. doesn’t understand the question
Overall means _____. a. completely b. higher than c. in general d. permanently
When a speaker makes a point, he or she _____. a. finishes a speech b. points at audience members c. communicates an idea d. disagrees with someone
If you have good spatial ability, you can _____. a. handle numbers well b. use a map well c. choose colors well d. communicate clearly

According to the reading, in the 1960s women _____. a. were more highly paid than men b. had equal rights with men c. were fighting for equality with men d. stopped thinking that they were the same as men
Boy babies are more interested in _____ than people. a. food b. music c. sounds d. objects
Researchers agree that girls _____. a. are more aggressive than boys b. have better language skills than boys c. are more active than boys d. have better math skills than boys
Which type of language do women generally use more than men? a. aggressive b. self-promoting c. supportive d. dominating
Which word below means almost the same as hauling ? a. carrying b. yelling c. thinking d. attempting
An innate ability is _____. a. one that no one else has b. one that a person has from birth c. one that has been carefully developed d. one that causes problems
Which animal is likely to be combative ? a. a sheep b. a bull c. a cow d. a horse
A strenuous exercise is one that is _____. a. done outdoors b. beneficial c. exhausting d. done by a large group
People usually boast because they are _____. a. proud b. tired c. angry d. forgetful
What task do sub-Saharan African women usually not do? a. haul firewood b. construct houses c. carry goods to market d. hunt
Margaret Mead found that in the Tchambuli tribe the men _____. a. provided the food b. were interested in romance c. shaved their heads d. didn’t wear ornaments
According to the reading, in Russia, most _____ are women. a. politicians b. business owners c. teachers d. doctors
According to Lenski, in hunting and gathering societies, _____. a. the men do all the hunting b. the children help with the hunting c. the women do all the hunting d. men and women hunt together
Deborah Tannen is ____. a. an anthropologist b. a sociolinguist c. an English teacher d. a sociologist
Deborah Tannen studies ____. a. communication between humans and animals b. communication between men and women c. communication in a second language d. communication between children and adults
Deborah Tannen says men use ____. a. more direct language than women b. more indirect language than women c. language for emotional connection d. better vocabulary than women

Tannen believes the workplace could be improved a. if men and women understand their language styles b. if women work only with women c. if men work only with men d. if only experienced workers are hired
Tannen reports that men view conversations in the workplace as ____. a. ways to gain power b. ways to become intimate c. ways to make new friends d. ways to communicate personal needs and desires
Bring about means the same as turn around .
A person’s status shows how much they have achieved.
Internet postings are the same as e-mails.
If you and a friend have an adversarial conversation, you have a disagreement.
Put-downs are the same as compliments.
Scientists think there are important differences between the ways men and women think and act.
Male and female brains are exactly alike.
Men prefer bright colors and women prefer soft colors.
Women worry more about their health than men do.
Paying women less than men for the same work is exploitative.
Primping can mean preparing ones clothes carefully before going out.
If you are preoccupied with something, you are ignoring it.
If society assigns a trait to a group of people, it says that all the people in the group have that trait.
A mundane problem is a very unusual one.
Gender roles do not vary very much from one culture to another.
In Sub-Saharan regions of Africa, men spend a lot of time talking.
In some cultures, only men are allowed to be farmers.
Margaret Mead believed that personality traits were determined by social conditioning.
In most cultures, feminine traits are valued more highly than masculine traits.
When you compare two or more things in a comparison and contrast essay, you must compare the same aspects of both.
Using block style organization, one item is completely discussed in one paragraph and another item is completely discussed in another paragraph.
Point by point organization is used only when items are compared, not contrasted.
Nevertheless and even though are contrast indicators.
Just as and likewise are comparison indicators.
Is this a point-by-point essay or a block style?
What contrast structure words were used in the essay?
What rules of a point-by-point contrast essay are followed in the essay, "Language Styles in the Workplace"?
